sentences: Pamela Harrison (28 November 1915 – 28 August 1990) was an English pianist, music teacher and composer.
Pamela Harrison was born in Orpington, England, and studied with Gordon Jacob and Arthur Benjamin at the Royal College of Music in London.
She made her debut as a composer with String Quartet in 1944 at the National Gallery concerts.
Harrison died in a car accident in Firle, East Sussex.
